## Colab is great, but...

- Limited amount of free compute time offered by Google
- Not much flexibility or control over the documents
- Limited ability to customize workspace
  - What if you want to see your text, your code, your plots, your data, your variables, etc, and have tools for debugging, report creation, etc
- Not great for larger projects or data sets
- Not great for production quality reports and presentations
- Not a great workspace for a professional data scientist


## Install programs (hopefully)

- Python: [Install Anaconda](https://www.anaconda.com/download)
- Report/presentation production: [Install Quarto](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/)
- Workspace (IDE - Integrated Development Environment): [Install Positron](https://positron.posit.co/start.html)
- Then open the file `msba-workshop-quarto.qmd` in Positron


## Version control/collaboration and Git/GitHub

- You are probably familiar with tools like "track changes" or shared Google docs
- Colab has similar features
- Git/GitHub enables version control/collaboration on a much larger scale
- Create a [GitHub account](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/start-your-journey/creating-an-account-on-github)
- Try the [GitHub tutorial](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/start-your-journey/hello-world)
- Watch this [video]((https://youtu.be/BCQHnlnPusY?si=NVumTv9G_SphSvMd))
